intro: Psychotria amplithyrsa, commonly known as the broad-leafed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It often grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Psychotria amplithyrsa is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
